message_history.content:
Answer the given question. You must conduct reasoning inside <think> and </think> first every time you get new information. After reasoning, if you find you lack some knowledge, you can call a search engine by <search> query </search> and it will return the top searched results between <information> and </information>. You can search as many times as your want. If you find no further external knowledge needed, you can directly provide the answer inside <answer> and </answer>, without detailed illustrations. For example, <answer> Beijing </answer>. Question: Please provide a complete list, up to 2024 (excluding 2024), of UNESCO World Heritage sites located in North America (namely US, Canada, and Mexico) , including their location (the main county/city where the sites are located in), type (cultural, natural, or mixed), area (in hectares), and the year of their recognition.  For any information not found online, please fill in "NA".

Please output the organized data in a single Markdown table. The column names in the table should be as follows, in order:
Country, Name of the Heritage Site, Type of Heritage, Location, Area, Year of Recognition

Don't ask me any questions, just output the results according to the columns without omitting cells arbitrarily. The output format is ```markdown
{data_content}
```?

<think>
To start, I need to gather information about UNESCO World Heritage sites in North America for each country separately. Let's begin with the United States.
</think>

<search>UNESCO World Heritage sites in the United States </search>

Search query: UNESCO World Heritage sites in the United States
Result: [Doc 1](https://whc.unesco.org/fr/etatsparties/us):
États-Unis d'Amérique - UNESCO Convention du patrimoine mondial Civil Rights Movement Sites · Dayton Aviation Sites · Thomas Jefferson Buildings · Mount Vernon · Serpent Mound · Okefenokee National Wildlife Refuge · Petrified ...

[Doc 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_World_Heritage_Sites_in_the_United_States):
List of World Heritage Sites in the United States - Wikipedia There are 26 World Heritage Sites in the United States, with a further 17 on the tentative list. Map of the US showing the locations of World Heritage Sites.

[Doc 3](https://2009-2017.state.gov/p/io/unesco/c48319.htm):
World Heritage Sites in the United States The following are World Heritage Sites in the United States: Kluane/Wrangell-St. Elias/Glacier Bay/Tatshenshini-Alsek (Alaska)

Let's compile the details for the U.S. sites first.
<search>UNESCO World Heritage sites in Canada </search>

Search query: UNESCO World Heritage sites in Canada
Result: [Doc 1](https://parks.canada.ca/culture/spm-whs/sites-canada):
Canadian Sites on the World Heritage List - Parks Canada Canadian Sites on the World Heritage List · Wood Buffalo National Park · Canadian Rocky Mountain Parks · Historic District of Old Québec.

[Doc 2](https://whc.unesco.org/en/statesparties/ca):
Canada - UNESCO World Heritage Convention Head-Smashed-In Buffalo Jump (1981) · Historic District of Old Québec (1985) · L'Anse aux Meadows National Historic Site (1978) · Landscape of Grand Pré (2012) ...

[Doc 3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_World_Heritage_Sites_in_Canada):
List of World Heritage Sites in Canada - Wikipedia List of World Heritage Sites in Canada ; Rocky Mountain Parks ; Dinosaur ; Gros Morne ; Head-Smashed-In ; Old Québec.

Now let’s compile the details for Canada.

Result: [Doc 1](https://whc.unesco.org/fr/etatsparties/mx):
Mexique - UNESCO Convention du patrimoine mondial Mexique · Chapultepec Woods, Hill and Castle · Historic Town of Alamos · Church of Santa Prisca and its Surroundings · Pre-Hispanic City of Cantona · Great City of ...

[Doc 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_World_Heritage_Sites_in_Mexico):
List of World Heritage Sites in Mexico - Wikipedia Numbers indicate the following sites: 1. Downtown Mexico City and Xochimilco; 2. Central campus of the University City of UNAM; 3. Monasteries on the slopes of ...

[Doc 3](https://www.worldheritagesite.org/countries/mexico/):
UNESCO World Heritage Sites in Mexico World Heritage Sites · Aqueduct of Padre Tembleque · Archipiélago de Revillagigedo · Calakmul · Camino Real · Campeche · Caves of Yagul and Mitla · Central ...

Let's compile the details for Mexico.

Serpent Mound - Wikipedia The Great Serpent Mound is a 1,348-feet-long (411m), four-feet-high prehistoric effigy mound located in Peebles, Ohio. It was built on what is known as the ...

Serpent Mound Historical Site, an Ohio State Memorial located near ... Nearly a quarter of a mile long, Serpent Mound apparently represents an uncoiling serpent. Serpent Mound lies on a plateau overlooking the valley of Brush Creek ...
